kanji.mnemonic: A single horizontal line representing the number one
Two horizontal lines stacked

examples: 三人 (さんにん) - three people
kanji.mnemonic: Three horizontal lines stacked
Four sides to a square
Resembles the number 5

examples: 六人 (ろくにん) - six people
kanji.mnemonic: Lid over a box

examples: 七人 (しちにん) - seven people
kanji.mnemonic: Seven with a hook

examples: 八人 (はちにん) - eight people
kanji.mnemonic: Two diverging lines

examples: 九つ (ここのつ) - nine things
九人 (きゅうにん) - nine people
kanji.mnemonic: Hook with a line

examples: 十人 (じゅうにん) - ten people
kanji.mnemonic: Cross shape

examples: 三百 (さんびゃく) - three hundred
kanji.mnemonic: Centipede wearing a hat

examples: 三千 (さんぜん) - three thousand
kanji.mnemonic: Person shouting from a cliff

examples: 一万 (いちまん) - ten thousand
百万 (ひゃくまん) - one million
kanji.mnemonic: Swarm of bees under a roof

examples: 千円札 (せんえんさつ) - 1,000 yen bill
kanji.mnemonic: Round coin with legs

2.category: 暦の漢字 (こよみのかんじ / Calendar Kanji)
2.description: Kanji used in dates, days, and time periods

examples: 月曜日 (げつようび) - Monday
今月 (こんげつ) - this month
kanji.calendar_usage: Used in month names and Monday
kanji.mnemonic: Looks like a crescent moon in the night sky
Flames flickering upward like fire

examples: 水曜日 (すいようび) - Wednesday
水道 (すいどう) - water supply
kanji.mnemonic: Flowing water drops or waves

examples: 木曜日 (もくようび) - Thursday
kanji.mnemonic: A tree with branches and roots

examples: 金曜日 (きんようび) - Friday
金色 (きんいろ) - gold color
kanji.mnemonic: Shiny gold bars or coins
Ground or soil with layers

examples: 日曜日 (にちようび) - Sunday
一日 (ついたち) - 1st day of month
kanji.mnemonic: A bright sun shining in the sky

examples: 去年 (きょねん) - last year
三年生 (さんねんせい) - 3rd grade student
kanji.calendar_usage: Used for years and school grades
kanji.mnemonic: A person carrying a heavy load representing a year

examples: 分かる (わかる) - to understand
kanji.mnemonic: A sword used to divide things, like time

weekday_pattern: 日 Sun | 月 Mon | 火 Tue | 水 Wed | 木 Thu | 金 Fri | 土 Sat

3.category: 体の部分 (からだのぶぶん / Body Parts)
3.description: Essential kanji for human body vocabulary

examples: 日本人 (にほんじん) - Japanese person
三人 (さんにん) - three people
kanji.mnemonic: Two legs walking - the simplest human form
Looks like an open mouth
Horizontal strokes resemble eyelashes

examples: 耳鼻科 (じびか) - ENT clinic
耳飾り (みみかざり) - earring
kanji.mnemonic: Shape resembles an ear
Looks like fingers extending
The 口 is the knee, 止 is the foot

examples: 電力 (でんりょく) - electric power
kanji.mnemonic: A flexed bicep muscle showing strength

4.category: 自然の漢字 (しぜんのかんじ / Nature Kanji)
4.description: Essential kanji for natural elements and landscapes

examples: 富士山 (ふじさん) - Mt. Fuji
山登り (やまのぼり) - mountain climbing
kanji.mnemonic: Three peaks of a mountain range
Three flowing water lines

examples: 田んぼ (たんぼ) - rice paddy
水田 (すいでん) - irrigated rice field
kanji.mnemonic: Grid of rice field divisions
Cliff (厂) with a mouth-shaped stone (口) below
Plants (艹) transforming (化) into flowers

examples: 竹林 (ちくりん) - bamboo forest
竹馬 (たけうま) - stilts (lit. bamboo horse)
kanji.mnemonic: Two bamboo stalks with leaves

examples: 大雨 (おおあめ) - heavy rain
kanji.mnemonic: Cloud (一) with falling raindrops

5.category: 方向の漢字 (ほうこうのかんじ / Directional Kanji)
5.description: Kanji derived from symbolic representations of spatial relationships

kanji.origin: Symbol of a plant growing upward
examples: 上手 (じょうず) - skillful (lit. 'upper hand')
上がる (あがる) - to rise
kanji.mnemonic: The short line points upward from the base

examples: 下がる (さがる) - to descend
kanji.mnemonic: The dot points downward like a falling object

kanji.origin: Symbol of a left hand holding a tool
examples: 左右 (さゆう) - left and right
左側 (ひだりがわ) - left side
kanji.mnemonic: The 工 radical resembles a carpenter's square held in the left hand

kanji.origin: Symbol of a right hand near a mouth (for eating)
examples: 右側 (みぎがわ) - right side
kanji.mnemonic: The 口 represents a mouth being fed by the right hand

examples: 外国 (がいこく) - foreign country
外出 (がいしゅつ) - going out
kanji.mnemonic: Evening (夕) outside the walls
Person (人) within walls

examples: 中国 (ちゅうごく) - China (Middle Kingdom)
kanji.mnemonic: Line through a box marks the center

6.category: 学校の漢字 (がっこうのかんじ / School Kanji)
6.description: Essential kanji for school life and education

kanji.mnemonic: Child (子) under a roof (宀) with books

examples: 校舎 (こうしゃ) - school building
kanji.mnemonic: Wooden (木) structure where knowledge is exchanged (交)

examples: 先週 (せんしゅう) - last week
kanji.school_usage: Used for seniority in school hierarchy
kanji.mnemonic: A person (儿) with a pointed hat (⺧) going first

examples: 生活 (せいかつ) - daily life
誕生日 (たんじょうび) - birthday
kanji.mnemonic: Plant sprouting from earth (life beginning)

kanji.school_usage: Used in attendance lists and IDs
kanji.mnemonic: Evening (夕) when people call names by mouth (口)
Child (子) under a roof (宀) learning letters

examples: 教科書 (きょうかしょ) - textbook
kanji.mnemonic: A tree (木) with roots marked (一) - the 'origin' book

examples: 体育 (たいいく) - physical education
体力 (たいりょく) - physical strength
体調 (たいちょう) - physical condition
kanji.school_usage: Used in health and P.E. contexts
kanji.mnemonic: A person (亻) whose roots (本) form their body

7.category: 学校の漢字 - 上級 (がっこうのかんじ - じょうきゅう / School Kanji - Advanced)
7.description: Kanji for classroom dynamics, sizes, and school relationships

examples: 大勢 (おおぜい) - large group of people
kanji.school_usage: Used for important school concepts and groups

examples: 小学校 (しょうがっこう) - elementary school
小テスト (しょうテスト) - quiz
小グループ (しょうグループ) - small group
kanji.mnemonic: Three drops representing something small

examples: 高校 (こうこう) - high school
高得点 (たかとくてん) - high score
kanji.school_usage: Used for academic levels and achievements

examples: 学友 (がくゆう) - school friend
kanji.mnemonic: Two hands (又) helping each other

examples: 入学 (にゅうがく) - school admission
入室 (にゅうしつ) - entering a room
入力 (にゅうりょく) - input (computer class)
kanji.school_usage: For school admissions and classroom activities

examples: 出欠 (しゅっけつ) - attendance record
提出 (ていしゅつ) - submission (of homework)
kanji.mnemonic: Mountain (山) with something coming out

examples: 校門 (こうもん) - school gate
門限 (もんげん) - curfew (school dormitory)
正門 (せいもん) - main entrance
専門 (せんもん) - specialty (as in 専門学校 vocational school)
kanji.mnemonic: Two swinging gate doors with a lintel on top

8.category: 家族の漢字 (かぞくのかんじ / Family Kanji)
8.description: Essential kanji for family members and relationships

kanji.mnemonic: Hands holding a tool (axe) - traditional father role

examples: 母子 (ぼし) - mother and child
kanji.mnemonic: Woman with breasts (nursing mother)
Baby with outstretched arms

examples: 男の子 (おとこのこ) - boy (child)
kanji.mnemonic: Strength (力) in the fields (田)

examples: 女の子 (おんなのこ) - girl (child)
kanji.mnemonic: Person kneeling (traditional female posture)

examples: 弟 (おとうと) - my younger brother
弟分 (おとうとぶん) - junior (like a brother)
妹 (いもうと) - my younger sister
妹分 (いもうとぶん) - junior (like a sister)
野鳥 (やちょう) - wild bird
鳥居 (とりい) - Shinto shrine gate (literally 'bird perch')
kanji.scientific_term: 鳥類 (ちょうるい) - avian species
kanji.mnemonic: Looks like a bird with a crest (丿), eye (目), and tail feathers (灬)

examples: 番犬 (ばんけん) - guard dog
kanji.medical_term: 狂犬病 (きょうけんびょう) - rabies
kanji.mnemonic: Big (大) with a drop 丶 → 'big' animal that drools

9.category: 動詞の漢字 (どうしのかんじ / Kanji Verbs)

examples: 建立 (こんりゅう) - erection (of buildings)
kanji.grammar_notes: Transitive/Intransitive pair: 立つ (intr.) vs 立てる (tr.)

kanji.mnemonic: Person (亻) leaning against a tree (木) to rest

readings.kunyomi: み(る), み(える), み(せる)

examples: 見せる (みせる) - to show
kanji.usage_note: 見える is potential form ('can see')

examples: 聞こえる (きこえる) - to be audible
kanji.cultural_note: Used for both listening and asking in Japanese

readings.onyomi: コウ, ギョウ, アン
readings.kunyomi: い(く), ゆ(く), おこな(う)

examples: 行う (おこなう) - to conduct
kanji.irregularities: 行く has two kunyomi readings (いく/ゆく)

examples: 来週 (らいしゅう) - next week
来日 (らいにち) - visit to Japan
kanji.grammar_note: Only irregular verb ending in -くる

examples: 帰る (かえる) - to return home
帰国 (きこく) - return to one's country
kanji.mnemonic: Left side shows movement, right shows direction

10.category: 食べ物の漢字 (たべもののかんじ / Food)
10.description: Essential kanji for ingredients, cooking, and dining

examples: 白米 (はくまい) - white rice
米国 (べいこく) - America (lit. 'rice country')
茶碗 (ちゃわん) - rice/tea bowl
kanji.mnemonic: Plants (艹) under a roof (余) being processed into tea

examples: 牛乳 (ぎゅうにゅう) - milk
和牛 (わぎゅう) - wagyu beef
魚料理 (さかなりょうり) - fish dishes
魚市場 (うおいちば) - fish market
kanji.mnemonic: Pictograph of a fish with fins

examples: 帆立貝 (ほたてがい) - scallop
好物 (こうぶつ) - favorite food

kanji.grammar_note: Combines with verbs to mean 'thing to...'

11.category: 自然の漢字-2 (しぜんのかんじ-2 / Nature-2)
11.description: Advanced kanji for natural landscapes and phenomena

examples: 林道 (りんどう) - forest path
竹林 (ちくりん) - bamboo grove
kanji.mnemonic: Two trees (木) together = small forest

examples: 森閑 (しんかん) - forest silence
森の妖精 (もりのようせい) - forest spirit
kanji.mnemonic: Three trees (木) = dense forest
Mountain (山) with stones (石) = big rock

examples: 麦畑 (むぎばたけ) - wheat field
畑仕事 (はたけしごと) - farm work
茶畑 (ちゃばたけ) - tea plantation
kanji.mnemonic: Fire (火) + field (田) = burned field for crops
Stand (立) in the sun (日) hearing sounds
Sun (日) + moon (月) = brightness
Sun (日) covered by sounds (音) = darkness

12.category: 動詞の漢字-2 (どうしのかんじ-2 / Verbs-2)
12.description: Essential kanji for communication and daily actions

kanji.mnemonic: Hand holding a brush (聿) recording words (曰)

examples: 音読 (おんどく) - reading aloud
食べる (たべる) - to eat
食堂 (しょくどう) - dining hall
kanji.mnemonic: Person kneeling under a roof with food

examples: 飲食 (いんしょく) - food and drink
kanji.stroke_pattern: Left radical first, then right 欠 (lack) component

kanji.mnemonic: Shell currency (貝) + net (罒) = catching a deal

13.category: 町の漢字 (まちのかんじ / Town)
13.description: Common kanji related to towns, directions, and urban life

examples: 町長 (ちょうちょう) - town mayor
金閣寺 (きんかくじ) - Kinkakuji Temple
kanji.mnemonic: Temple built with measured hands
A cart with four wheels and an axle

examples: 北海道 (ほっかいどう) - Hokkaido
北口 (きたぐち) - north exit
kanji.mnemonic: Two people turning away from the cold north

examples: 南口 (みなみぐち) - south exit
南米 (なんべい) - South America
kanji.mnemonic: An ancient compass pointing to the sun-warmed south

examples: 東口 (ひがしぐち) - east exit
東洋 (とうよう) - the East (Asia)
kanji.mnemonic: The sun rising behind a tree in the east

examples: 関西 (かんさい) - Kansai region
西洋 (せいよう) - the West (Europe, America)
kanji.mnemonic: The sun setting behind a covered horizon in the west

14.category: 時間の漢字 (じかんのかんじ / Time)
14.description: Essential kanji for telling time and temporal concepts

examples: 何分 (なんぷん) - how many minutes
何歳 (なんさい) - how old
半時間 (はんじかん) - half hour
分かる (わかる) - to understand
十分 (じゅうぶん) - enough (lit. 'ten minutes')
七夕 (たなばた) - Star Festival
方角 (ほうがく) - compass direction
夕方 (ゆうがた) - evening time
kanji.time_usage: Used in time periods like 朝方 (morning time)

examples: 今週 (こんしゅう) - this week
人間 (にんげん) - human (lit. 'between people')

15.description: Common kanji related to time, periods, and moments in daily life

examples: 何人 (なんにん) - how many people
kanji.mnemonic: A person asking a question about something unknown

examples: 半年 (はんとし) - half a year
kanji.mnemonic: Half a line crossing ten to show division

examples: 分かる (わかる) - to understand
kanji.mnemonic: A sword used to divide things, like time
The shape of the moon in the early evening sky

examples: あの方 (あのかた) - that person (polite)
kanji.mnemonic: A person pointing toward a direction or method

examples: 今月 (こんげつ) - this month
kanji.mnemonic: A person under a cover, representing the current moment
A temple that keeps track of the sun = time
The sun seen through a gate, marking the passage of time
